snippet: A federal appeals court ruled Friday that the Forest Service’s policies permitting gold mining in rivers in national forests violated the Endangered Species Act.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that the Forest Service's policies permitting gold mining in rivers in national forests violate the Endangered Species Act; the Karuk Tribe of Northern California filed a lawsuit claiming that some types of gold mining in the Klamath River pose risks to coho salmon, a federally protected species.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ruled Friday that the Forest Service’s policies permitting gold mining in rivers in national forests violated the Endangered Species Act.
